title: Sciver-Brunt’s historic century powers England to top spot
byline: Nat Sciver-Brunt produced a captain’s knock of the highest order as her record-breaking fifth ICC Women’s World Cup hundred was the catalyst for England’s 89-run win over Sri Lanka.

title: Seychelles’s Patrick Herminie wins presidential run-off election
byline: Seychelles’s opposition leader, Patrick Herminie, has won the country’s presidential race, defeating incumbent leader Wavel Ramkalawan in a run-off vote, according to the electoral commission.

title: Gazette issued confirming Cabinet reshuffle
byline: The official Gazette confirming ministerial and deputy ministerial changes following the government’s first cabinet reshuffle has been issued by the Secretary to the President, Dr. N.S. Kumanayake.

title: Doctors’ Union warns of mismanaged drug supply despite government assurances
byline: Although the Health Ministry and the State Pharmaceuticals Corporation (SPC) have repeatedly assured that Sri Lanka’s drug shortage will be completely resolved by early 2026, an oversupply of nearly a hundred essential and non-essential drug items has been reported in several major hospitals across the country, Chairman of the Medical and Civil Rights Doctors’ Trade Union Alliance, Specialist Dr. Chamal Sanjeewa said.

title: No survivors found after Tennessee explosives plant blast
byline: Sixteen people missing after a major explosion at a Tennessee munitions factory on Friday are presumed to be dead, according to the sheriff.

title: Prime Minister departs for China
byline: Airport officials confirmed that Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasooriya departed from Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) last night (11) to attend an international women’s conference being held in China.

title: Academy Award-winning actress Diane Keaton dies aged 79
byline: Oscar-winning actress Diane Keaton has died at the age of 79.

title: WHO chief arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: World Health Organization (WHO) Director-General Dr. Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus arrived in Sri Lanka this morning (12) to attend the 78th Session of the WHO South-East Asia Regional Committee as the chief guest.

title: Two killed in lorry accident in Narammala
byline: Two men were killed in an early morning accident  in the Narammala Police area today (12).

title: Seychelles’s Patrick Herminie wins presidential run-off election
byline: Seychelles’s opposition leader, Patrick Herminie, has won the country’s presidential race, defeating incumbent leader Wavel Ramkalawan in a run-off vote, according to the electoral commission.

title: No survivors found after Tennessee explosives plant blast
byline: Sixteen people missing after a major explosion at a Tennessee munitions factory on Friday are presumed to be dead, according to the sheriff.

title: IGP to seek Attorney General’s assistance over Mount Lavinia court incident
byline: Inspector General of Police (IGP) Priyantha Weerasuriya said that he will seek the assistance of the Attorney General on behalf of the police officer involved in the recent incident between a police officer and a lawyer at the Mount Lavinia court premises.

title: President assures Rs. 1,750 daily wage for plantation workers within this year
byline: The government will take steps to ensure that plantation workers get a minimum daily wage of Rs. 1,750 within this year, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today.

title: Gauff beats Pegula to win Wuhan Open title
byline: Coco Gauff became the first player to win her first nine hard court finals as she beat Jessica Pegula in straight sets to win the Wuhan Open.

title: Vacherot beats cousin for historic Shanghai title
byline: World number 204 Valentin Vacherot upset his cousin Arthur Rinderknech to win his first ATP title at the Shanghai Masters.

title: Seales fined for breaching ICC Code of Conduct
byline: Fast bowler Jayden Seales of the West Indies has been fined 25 per cent of his match fee for breaching Level 1 of the ICC Code of Conduct during the opening day of the second Test against India in New Delhi on Friday.
